en: O give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
hmr: Aw LALPA kuomah lâwmthu hril ro, ama chu a ṭha sih a; A ngilneina khawm kumkhuoin a um ding a ni sih a,

en: Let the redeemed of Jehovah say so, Whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the adversary,
hmr: LALPA mi intlanhai chun chuong ang chun hril raw se, Dotu kuta inthawka a întlan,

en: And gathered out of the lands, From the east and from the west, From the north and from the south.
hmr: Ram tina inthawka a ṭhuoi khâwm, Sak le thlang, sim le hmâra inthawkhai dâm chun.

en: They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way; They found no city of habitation.
hmr: Thlalêra ram ṭâwl lampuia chun an invâk an invâk a, Mihriem umna khuo hrim hrim an hmu nawh a.

en: Hungry and thirsty, Their soul fainted in them.
hmr: Phîngṭâm le dangchârin, An hringna chu an sûngah a chau tah a.

en: Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble, And he delivered them out of their distresses,
hmr: Chu phingleh an buoinaa chun LALPA chu an ko tah a, Ama chun an lunginzîngnaa inthawk chun a sanhim a.

en: He led them also by a straight way, That they might go to a city of habitation.
hmr: Mihriem umna khuoa an fe theina dingin, Lampui tlûntakah a ṭhuoi tah a.

en: Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness, And for his wonderful works to the children of men!
hmr: Aw, mihriemhai hin LALPA chu a ngilneina lei le, Mihriem nauhai chunga a thilmak thawhai lei hin inpâk hai sien aw!

en: For he satisfieth the longing soul, And the hungry soul he filleth with good.
hmr: Ama chun hringna thil châk êm êm chu a sukkhawpin, Hringna phîngṭâm chu ṭhatnain a sukkhawp sih a.

en: Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, Being bound in affliction and iron,
hmr: Inthim hnuoia le thina hlima ṭhung a, Rinumna le thîra khuophai chu;

en: Because they rebelled against the words of God, And contemned the counsel of the Most High:
hmr: Pathien thuhai chungah an hel a, Achunghnungtak remruot chu an ngainêp leiin.

en: Therefore he brought down their heart with labor; They fell down, and there was none to help.
hmr: Ama chun an lungril chu inrimnain a sukhnuoi a, An tluh a, ṭhangpuitu ding hrim an um si nawh a.

en: Then they cried unto Jehovah in their trouble, And he saved them out of their distresses.
hmr: Chu phingleh an buoinaa chun LALPA chu an ko a, Ama chun an lungzîngnaa inthawk chun a sandam a.

en: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, And brake their bonds in sunder.
hmr: Inthim hnuoi le thina hlima inthawk chun a ṭhuoi suok a, An khuopnahai chu a suktan tah a.

en: Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness, And for his wonderful works to the children of men!
hmr: Aw mihriemhai hin LALPA chu a ngilneina lei le, Mihriem nauhai chunga a thilmak thawhai lei hin inpâk hai sien aw!

en: For he hath broken the gates of brass, And cut the bars of iron in sunder.
hmr: Ama chun dâr kawtkhârhai chu a suksiet a, A kalna thîrtluonhai chu a sukbawng ta sih a.

en: Fools because of their transgression, And because of their iniquities, are afflicted.
hmr: Mi invêthai chu an bawsietna lei le, An rîtlonahai leiin an insukrinum hlak a.

en: Their soul abhorreth all manner of food; And they draw near unto the gates of death.
hmr: An hringna chun fâk ding tinrêng hi a tirdak hlak a, Thina kul kawtkhârhai chu an hnai hlak a.

en: Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble, And he saveth them out of their distresses.
hmr: Chu phingleh an buoinaa chun LALPA chu an ko a, Ama chun an lungzingnaa inthawk chun a sandam hlak.

en: He sendeth his word, and healeth them, And delivereth them from their destructions.
hmr: A thu chu a tirsuok a, anni chu a sukdam hlak a, An bohmangna dinghaia inthawk chun a sanhim hlak.

en: Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness, And for his wonderful works to the children of men!
hmr: Aw mihriemhai hin LALPA chu a ngilneina lei le, Mihriem nauhai chunga a thilmak thawhai lei hin inpâk hai sien chu aw!

en: And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving, And declare his works with singing.
hmr: Anni chun lâwmthu hrilna inthâwinahai chu inhlân hai sienla, A thilthawhai chu hlaa sakin hril raw hai se.

en: They that go down to the sea in ships, That do business in great waters;
hmr: Tuisuorieta lawng liena zu feh a, Tui lientak chunghaia sin thaw hlakhai chun,

en: These see the works of Jehovah, And his wonders in the deep.
hmr: Chuonghai chun LALPA thilthawhai le, Tui inthûktaka a thilmak thawhai chu an hmu hlak.

en: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, Which lifteth up the waves thereof.
hmr: Ama chun thu a pêk a, thlipui ân hrângtir a, Chu chun a tuifâwnhai chu a suksâng hlak.

en: They mount up to the heavens, they go down again to the depths: Their soul melteth away because of trouble.
hmr: Vân tieng an hung tuol tuol a, inthûktakah an ṭum nâwk tuol tuol hlak, Lunginzîngna leiin an hringna chu ân tuihmang hlak.

en: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, And are at their wits’ end.
hmr: Zurui angin an thle an thleh a, an pêm nawk nawk hlak a, Um ngaina hrim hrim an hriet ngai nawh.

en: Then they cry unto Jehovah in their trouble, And he bringeth them out of their distresses.
hmr: Chu phingleh an buoinaa chun LALPA chu an ko a, Ama chun an lungzîngnaa inthawk chun a ṭhuoi suok hlak.

en: He maketh the storm a calm, So that the waves thereof are still.
hmr: Thlipui chu a sukma ṭhuop a, Chuongchun, a tuifâwnhai a re ṭhup hlak.

en: Then are they glad because they are quiet; So he bringeth them unto their desired haven.
hmr: Chun, a re ta leiin an lâwm hlak a; Chuongchun, ama chun an ngaitak likilkawia chun a ṭhuoi tlung hlak.

en: Oh that men would praise Jehovah for his lovingkindness, And for his wonderful works to the children of men!
hmr: Aw, mihriemhai hin LALPA chu a zainêmna lei le Mihriem nauhai chunga a thilmak thawhai lei hin inpâk hai sien chu aw!

en: Let them exalt him also in the assembly of the people, And praise him in the seat of the elders.
hmr: Anni chun mihai inkhâwmnaah ama chu inpâk sienla, Upahai ṭhungnaa chun inpâk raw se.

en: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, And watersprings into a thirsty ground;
hmr: Ama chun vadungpuihai chu thlalêrah ân changtir hlak a, Tuihnârhai chu hnuoi ṭâwlah ân changtir bawk hlak.

en: A fruitful land into a salt desert, For the wickedness of them that dwell therein.
hmr: Ram ṭha chu ram ṭâwl chawkah ân changtir hlak a, A sûnga umhai rîtlona leiin.

en: He turneth a wilderness into a pool of water, And a dry land into watersprings.
hmr: Thlalêr chu dîlah ân changtir hlak a, Ram ṭâwl chu tuihnârahai ân changtir bawk hlak.

en: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, That they may prepare a city of habitation,
hmr: Chutaka chun phîngṭâmhai chu ân umtir hlak a, Umna ding khuo an buotsai a.

en: And sow fields, and plant vineyards, And get them fruits of increase.
hmr: Lohai an nei a, grêp huonhai an siem a, A ra hung punghai chu an hmu theina dingin.

en: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; And he suffereth not their cattle to decrease.
hmr: Anni chu mal a sâwm hlak a, nasataka sukpungin an um a, An ranhai chu a kiem a phal ngai nawh a,

en: Again, they are diminished and bowed down Through oppression, trouble, and sorrow.
hmr: Chun, nêksâwrna dâm, rinum- na dâm, lungngai dâm leiin, An kiem ta sawt sawt a, an kûn ta thlawk thlawk a.

en: He poureth contempt upon princes, And causeth them to wander in the waste, where there is no way.
hmr: Ama chun mi lienhai chungah hmusitna a bunthlâk hlak a, Thlalêr lampui hrim hrim um nawnaa chun ân vâktir ân vâktir a.

en: Yet setteth he the needy on high from affliction, And maketh him families like a flock.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, rimsihai chu rinumnaa inthawkin hmun insângah a dawm kai hlak a, Ran ruol angin sûnghai a siempêk hlak.

en: The upright shall see it, and be glad; And all iniquity shall stop her mouth.
hmr: Mi indiktakhai chun chu chu hmûng an ta, lâwm an tih, Rîtlona po po chun a bau hip a tih,

en: Whoso is wise will give heed to these things; And they will consider the lovingkindnesses of Jehovah.
hmr: Tukhawm a var taphawt chun chuong chu vawng ṭhâng an ta, LALPA ngilneina chu ngaituong an tih.
